destination.short_desc: Turkey offers a rich tapestry of history, culture, and stunning landscapes. Istanbul, with its blend of ancient and modern, is the perfect starting point for exploration.
destination.short_history: Istanbul, historically known as Byzantium and Constantinople, has been a significant cultural and political center for centuries, bridging Europe and Asia. Its rich history is reflected in its diverse architecture and vibrant culture.

program.description: A former Greek Orthodox Christian basilica, later an Ottoman imperial mosque and now a museum, Hagia Sophia is a masterpiece of Byzantine architecture.
The former residence of the Ottoman sultans, Topkapi Palace is filled with exquisite artifacts and beautiful gardens.
Enjoy traditional Turkish cuisine at a local restaurant, featuring dishes like kebabs, mezes, and baklava.
An ancient underground water reservoir, the Basilica Cistern is known for its stunning columns and atmospheric lighting.
One of the largest and oldest covered markets in the world, the Grand Bazaar is a vibrant place to shop for souvenirs, textiles, and jewelry.
Experience the vibrant nightlife of Istanbul with a guided tour, visiting bars and clubs popular among locals.
This opulent palace served as the main administrative center of the Ottoman Empire in the 19th century, showcasing stunning architecture and gardens.
Enjoy a scenic cruise on the Bosphorus, taking in views of the city's skyline and historic landmarks from the water.
Celebrate the end of your trip with a farewell dinner at a restaurant overlooking the Bosphorus, enjoying local dishes and drinks.
